unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26 – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of homes with high-speed internet. This comes as demand for reliable broadband surges, driven by the increasing popularity of OTT platforms like Hotstar and the rise of remote work culture post-pandemic.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of homes with high-speed internet. unnormalised: Bharti Airtel recently announced plans to invest Rs. 5,000 Crores in FY24-25 to extend its fiber network to smaller towns and cities, targeting a reach of over 50,000 km. This initiative follows Jio's aggressive roll-out strategy, which has already connected a significant portion of urban households. Dr. Kumar Mangalam Birla, Chairman of Aditya Birla Group, commented on the necessity of robust digital infrastructure for India's economic growth.
